title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description:
An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, typing an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'defaultValue' field, still accepts the invalid value. The resulting report design shows the following definition:

<parameters>
  <scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
    <property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
    <property name="allowBlank">false</property>
    <property name="format">Unformatted</property>
    <property name="controlType">textbox</property>
    <expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalarparameter>
</parameters>

There are two problems here:
(1) The model should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
(2) The date value should be validated by the UI or model.
OB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and typing an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'defaultValue' field, the invalid value is accepted and shown in the report design.
EB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and typing an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'defaultValue' field, an error message should be displayed indicating that the date is invalid and the value should not be accepted.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
4. In the 'defaultValue' field, type an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Pay attention to whether the value is accepted and if any error messages regarding the invalid date are displayed.
